title: eternal life
comment: The state of being in a permanent living relationship with God, through Jesus Christ, begun in this life and consummated at the resurrection of believers.

children.title: eternal life, nature of
children.comment: Triumph over death and infinitely extended life. It also means a unique quality of life, knowing God in this life and sharing the life of Christ. Its source is God himself.

children.title: Eternal life is knowing God and enjoying his eternal blessings
Eternal glory is the believer's inheritance
Contrasted with eternal judgment and rejection

primaryrefs.comment: Interpreters differ over whether ``eternal punishment'' implies an experience that continues for ever, or annihilation which is eternal in the sense of being irreversible.

children.title: The work of helping others come to eternal life

primaryrefs.comment: ``firstfruits'' because the resurrection of Jesus Christ is seen as the beginning of a harvest.

children.title: Eternal life as a quality of life
One of the blessings associated with the kingdom of God
Eternal life as experiencing Jesus Christ's life
God is the source and giver of eternal life
eternal life, gift of
children.comment: Eternal life cannot be earned or merited but must be received as a gift from God.

children.title: Fruitless attempts to earn eternal life

primaryrefs.comment: It is possible to study the mere letter of Scripture while ignoring coming to its focus, Jesus Christ

children.title: Jesus Christ is the source of eternal life

primaryrefs.comment: Faith in Jesus Christ, God's son, is the only way to gain eternal life.

seealsos.comment: Repentance is the first step of commitment

children.title: eternal life, experience of
children.comment: Eternal life is a present possession, to to be experienced here and now, but it also offers rich and joyful future prospects.

children.title: Eternal life as a present possession
The Holy Spirit as a sign of new life
Eternal life as a future hope
Present experience the basis for future hope
Eternal life contrasted with present suffering
